interlinear-text.item: The king's son and the vizier's son

phrase.item: Once in a village, there was a kind and a vizier.
The king and the vizier grew up together, they couldn't live without each other.
They married at the same time, and after nine months and nine days they had babies.
The king and the vizier got very happy.
They celebrated seven days and nights and gave a lot of gold and silver to poor people.
The king named his son Shorukh and the vizier named his son Farukh.
They were taken care of and given milk by babysitters in the same place.
When they grew older they also played together.
And they also went to school together.
Eventually they turned twelve years old.
The king asked the vizier, "What is the best skill we can teach our children?"
The vizier said "swimming."
"If they have all [other] skills but cannot swim, their llives could be in danger.
For two years they were taught swimming by a trainer.
The two [boys] became the best swimmer, so that no one could compare to them.
One day both, Shorukh and Farukh fell asleep.
Suddenly, a trunk came across the water. Shorukh didn't wake up Farukh and he jumped in the water. He swam and reached the trunk.
He opened the lid and [saw] there was a beautiful girl inside, one side of her face was [like the] moon and the other side [like the] sun.
Shorukh saw her and immediately began to drown.
Only his hands were visible on the water.
Then suddenly Farukh woke up and saw that Shorukh was not there, he checked the river and saw that he was drowning.
He jumped right away and reached him.
He took him out of the water.
Farukh asked Shorukh, "Oh brother, what happened to you that made you start to drown?"
He replied: "Oh brother, don't ask me, while you were sleeping, a trunk was floating on the water, so I didn't wake you up, I jumped into the water and reached it.
"I opened the trunk and saw a girl, [so] beautiful that there is no one like her in the world.
"When I saw her face I lost my mind, then I woke up and found myself here, on the land with you.
Shorukh said, "If I don't ??? her I will kill myself [???]"
Farukh said, "There is no word like that [i.e., don't say things like that], I will go with you to look for [the girl].
They came home and without telling their parents they took food, loaded it onto a camel, and left to walk by the riverbank.
They went for several days and their food ran out.
Shorukh said, "Oh brother, what we should do? We will starve."
Farukh said, "We will slaughter the camel, eat it, and keep going."
"Its meat will be enough for us for several days."
They slaughtered the camel.
They cooked the meat and put it in a saddlebag and kept going.
They went for several more days.
That meat also ran out.
They saw in a forest smoke was coming out from somewhere.
They reached the smoke and saw a madman cooking food in forty cauldrons.
They greeted [him] and said, "We are very hungry."
"Give us a bit of food."
The madman said, "[I am one of] forty brothers, they went hunting and I am cooking them food."
"Each brother will eat one cauldron of food, I won't give you even a lick, [let alone] something to eat."
"When we finish eating will cook for you again from the beginning."
The madman asked them, "Who are you who are coming here?"
"Until today there were no human footsteps here [i.e., no one had set foot here]."
Shorukh and Farukh tell him their story from start to end [lit. from head to foot].
The madman told them, "The beautiful girl is our sister."
"So many people, madmen and fairies, are in love with her, but we have a challenge, and we will give our sister to whoever fulfills it."
His brothers came back from hunting and each ate a cauldron of food.
The madman told the story to his brothers.

Then the oldest brother said, "There is a sycamore, if you pull it out by the roots, cut it into little pieces, cook a cauldron of food with it, and one of you eats it alone, then we will give you our sister."
"If not then return back to where you are from."
[Shorukh went and pulled with all his strength, but he could not pull it up.]
[Then Farukh went and pulled with all his strength and dug the sycamore up by the roots, cut it into little pieces, ate a cauldron of food [that he made] with it, and licked the cauldron.]
[He passed the challenge, and the madman said, "Our sister is yours."]
[Farukh said, "This is my brother, we
